turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: I didn't know, I swear.  I thought it was next week.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Liar!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Take it easy.  We can talk about it.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: She's screaming on the street and I mean loud, but she looked good. She had these violet eyes.  I remember she's screaming, but mostly I'm looking at her eyes. They were just like Elizabeth Taylor's. That's what everybody said.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Talk? To you? After what you did!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: I thought you were going to stand me up. You looked bored. You didn't say anything. What did you expect. Tommy was all over me. Right?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What're you doing? What about the car?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: He watches it for me. It's better than waiting at a garage.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What do you do?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: I'm in construction.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: They don't feel like you're in construction.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Go inside. I'll be right there.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What are you gonna do?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Get inside!

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: My bag. My bag.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What bag?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: The bag with the envelopes.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Oh that. Don't worry about that. Nobody's gonna steal it.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I Don't know. I don't know if I could live that way. What if, God forbid, you go to prison. Mickey said Jeannie's husband --

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Are you nuts?  Jeannie's husband went to the can just to get away from her, she's such a pain in the ass. Let me tell you. Nobody goes to jail unless they want to, unless they make themselves get caught. They do stuff with the wrong people. They don't have things organized. You know who goes to jail? Nigger stickup men. That's who. And they only get caught because they fall asleep in the getaway car.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I'm gonna need some money.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: How much?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I don't care. Something's going on.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: That again.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Henry.  Wake up.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What's the matter with you?  You're crazy.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: It's all bullshit. I swear. It's nothing. Whatever you want, we'll do.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: The truth was, that no matter how bad I felt, I was still very attracted to him. Why should I give him up to someone else? Why should she win?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Son of a bitch.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I thought you were supposed to turn yourself in at ten o'clock this morning?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: I'm just having my last few drinks.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I've been all over town. I got a call from the bondman.  He says they're going to rescind your bail if you don't show up and sign in right now. They're going to take away the house.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Shit.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You son of a bitch. She's been here.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Don't lie to me. I saw her name in the register.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Jezuz Christ!

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You want her to visit you?  Good! Let her stay up all night crying and writing letters to the parole board.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What am I doing? I'm in here! I'm in jail. I can't stop people from coming to see me.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Stop! Stop!

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Let her carry this shit inside.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Nobody's helping me. Tommy got four years. Marty and Fran are broke.  I asked your friend Remo for the money he owed you, and you know what he told me?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: It'll be okay.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: He told me to take the kids to the police station and make the cops put me on welfare.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: We've got to help each other.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Even Paulie, since he got out, I hardly see him.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: It's only you and me. That's what happens when you go away. We're on our own. Forget everybody.  Forget Paulie.  As long as he's on parole he doesn't want anybody doing anything.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I can't do it anymore.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Yes, you can. I've got it set up. We'll be fine. All I need is for you to keep bringing the stuff. I've got a guy in here from Pittsburgh who'll move it for me. Believe me, in a month we'll be fine. We won't need anybody.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I'm afraid. I'm afraid if Paulie finds out.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Don't worry about Paulie. Is he helping you? Is he putting food on the table? We've got to help ourselves. We just have to be careful while we do it.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I don't want to hear about her anymore.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Never.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Get packed.  We're getting out of here.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: With what?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Don't worry with what. You just start looking for a new place. I'm going to Pittsburgh in the morning. The guys from Pittsburgh they owe me fifteen grand from our little partnership and it's only the beginning.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: But you've got to see your parole officer in the afternoon and  I promised we'd take Judy to F.A.O. Schwarz.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Don't worry about it. You listening to me? Now, come on. We gotta go see Paulie.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: I had everybody working.  Even our old babysitter.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: She's beautiful.  Look at her. Henry, look at her.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Hello!  Hello!  Have a good flight?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Jimmy's calling every day. It's urgent.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What did he say, exactly?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: At least Jimmy and Mickey want to help. I talk to Mickey every day. That's more than I can say for the rest.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Paul will calm down. You'll see.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I told Jimmy the cops took our cars and froze our bank accounts and he offered to get me some money. Be wants to know what's happening. You gotta meet him.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Fuck Jimmy and the money. Didn't I tell you I gotta get out of here first.  I gotta straighten every- thing out with Paulie or I'm dead.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Then you're safer in here.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Safe? Here? They'll kill me here. They're all afraid I'm gonna rat them out. People are already looking to walk away from me. I'm dead in here. You gotta get me out.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Who's gonna do that?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Just get me out.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: So now my plan was to stay alive long enough to sell off the dope that the cops never found and disappear for a while until I got things straightened out.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Where's the stuff?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: You know. The stuff I left.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I flushed it down the toilet.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: You what?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What did you want me to do with it? They were all over the house.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Are you fucking nuts? That was forty, fifty thousand.  I need it. I was depending on that money.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: They had a warrant. They went through everything. They would have found it. I swear.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Shit You know they would have never found it. Why did you do it? Why did you do it? My God, why did you have to do it?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Oh no! No!  Noooo!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What happened? You okay?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I got seared.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Okay. Don't worry about it. It's okay.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I got scared.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What about the schools?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Yeah. What about the kids' school?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What are we going to do with him? We can't dump him in the street.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Bring the car round back. I know a place Upstate they'll never find him.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Keep 'em coming.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Jimmy was one of the most feared gays in the city.  He was first locked up at eleven and was doing hits for mob bosses when he was sixteen. Hits never bothered him. It was business. But what he really loved to do was steal.  I mean, he actually enjoyed it.  Jimmy was the kind of guy who rooted for the bad guys in the movies.  He was one of the city's biggest hijackers. Clothes. Razor blades. Booze. Cigarettes. Shrimp and lobsters. Shrimp and lobsters were the best. They went fast.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: You got money for your bullshit television, don't you?  I gotta watch you swimming back and forth on TV all night long, don't I? You got money for that, but you don't have my money?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Jimmy. He'll be okay. He's good for it. Relax.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: We got a problem, that thing we took care of upstate?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Paulie was just talking about him.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Well, we gotta dig him up again.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: The guy just sold the property. They're gonna build condominiums and I don't want anybody digging up the little bastard.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: It's been six months.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: It's still better than letting somebody find him.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: If Paulie finds out, we got problems.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Fuck Paulie. If Batts' crew finds we whacked him, we got real problems.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: we're gonna feed the bastard to the lions.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What lions? I'm not going near any lions.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: We only have to shove'em over the moat.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: For Christmas. Your share.  It's just a taste.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Jimmy.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: We did it.  We did it.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Give'm a drink.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: I gotta talk to you.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Have a drink first.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Oh yeah? Anything you say.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What's going on? What happened to Stacks? Is everything okay?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Don't worry about it.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: There are cops all over the place.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: So what?  Where are they gonna go?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Paulie's gonna make him?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Who else? Paulie got the okay. This little guinea fuck. Someday he's gonna be a boss. Can you believe someday we'll work for him.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What'll I tell Fran?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Who gives a fuck? Tall her he ran away with a broad. What do you care about her.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Watch this.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Come on, don't fuck around, will ya?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I do it all the time. Bust their fucking balls.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Jimmy, come on. Fuck 'em. Don't give them the satisfaction.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: You want the melon?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Nah.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I better call again.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Jimmy and I could never be made, because we bad Irish blood. It didn't even matter that my mother was Sicilian. To become a member of a crew, you've got to be one hundred percent Italian So that they can trace all your relatives back to the old country.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: What fucking good are these things? They don't fit. What do I need this for? I'm not paying for this shit.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Right away I knew he didn't want them. I knew I was going to get stuck for the money. I only bought the damn guns because he wanted them. And now, he didn't want them. I didn't say a thing. Jimmy was so pissed he didn't even say goodbye.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: I can't eat,  just get me some coffee.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: He was jumpy. He hadn't touched a thing. In the old days, Jimmy would have ordered doubles and eaten it all.  On the surface, of course, everything was supposed to be fine. We were supposed to be discussing my case, just like we always would, but I had a feeling Jimmy was trying to sense whether I was going to rat him out to save my neck.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I think you got a good shot at beating the case.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: It's that rat bastard from Pittsburgh. He ratted you all out. He's been a rat since he got busted in Pittsburgh.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: He's hiding, thE son of a bitch, in Florida.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I want you and Anthony to go down there and take care of that bastard. Without him, they've got no case.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: I didn't agree to three points over the vig.- What am I nuts? I didn't need it that much.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What are you gonna do? Fight with him?  He wants his money.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: It's a fait accompli?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Done.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: And Jimmy's in it, right?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Will you stop.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: I want to talk to Jimmy.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: He heard.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: But I got two hundred and fifty coming.  It's my share.  Jimmy owes me.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Marty, please. Let me talk to him.

turns.speaker: TODDY
turns.text: What happened to you?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: I can't make any more deliveries.

turns.speaker: TODDY
turns.text: Whadda you mean, you can't make any more deliveries? You're going to fuck up everything?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: My father got a letter from the school. He said the next time he'll kill me.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: It was the first time I had ever seen anyone shot.

turns.speaker: TODDY
turns.text: You're some fucking jerk.

turns.speaker: TODDY
turns.text: I You wasted eight fucking aprons on that guy. :

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: I remember feeling bad about the guy. But I remember feeling that maybe Tuddy was right.  I knew Paulie didn't want anybody dying in the building.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Where'd you find such creeps?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: They're okay and it's worth it. Ain't it?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: You ready?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Tell Michael not to 1et the sauce stick.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: You know what to do?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Yeah, yeah.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Now this is important. Make sure you leave the house when you make the call. You understand? Do you hear me? It's important.  Call from an outside phone. I mean it.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Jesus! You must think I'm dumb. What are you bugging me for? I know what to do!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Just make sure you do it. You know what I mean?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: I gotta go home.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What for? I got a pound of stuff in my jacket I've been carrying around all day. We gotta start taping it to your leg.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: I gotta go home and get my hat.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Do you realize what we're involved in here now?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: I don't care. I need my hat.  I won't go without it.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What could I do?  If she insisted, I had to drive her home for her goddamn hat.  I threw the package in the kitchen and went to take her hone.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Come on, relax. He's drunk.  He's been locked up for six years.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: I don't give a shit. That guy's got no right.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Tommy. He. doesn't mean anything. Forget about it.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: He's insulting me. Rat bastard. He's never been any fuckin' good.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Tommy.  Come on. Relax.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Keep him here. I'm going for a bag.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Batts's made. His whole crew is going to be looking for him. This is fucking bad.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: There's a shovel at my mother's.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: You gotta help me. Okay? This girl I told you about? Diana? She's from the Five Towns. She's Jewish. She won't go out with me alone. Can you believe this shit? She's fucking prejudiced, but she's built. She's never been out with an Italian before. She says she'll only go out on a double date with her girlfriend.  You believe this shit? But you gotta see her. I mean, she's beautiful.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Will you get the fuck out of here.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Is it my fault she won't go out without her girlfriend?  For Chrissake.  Come on.  You don't even have to stay.  Jeesuz!  What's the big deal?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Tommy  ...

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Tommy, don't fuck around. Put the gun away. Tommy!

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: No, no. It's okay.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Tommy, come on. Put the gun away.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: No. It's okay. Just watch this. Watch it.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Stay there.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Don't start. I told you to clean up. Look at this place. It's a pigpen. Look around here. Why do you think I bought you the dishwasher? Look. Look at this.  There's enough powder around here to put us all away.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I hate to do dishes.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Hey, come on. I gotta meet somebody.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: So do I.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Are you okay? What happened?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Nothing. I dropped the soap. That's all.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I don't need this... You said tonight and now it's not tonight...

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: It's okay. I'll make it up.  I promise. Just hurry it up a little. Okay?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Okay?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: How is he? Okay? Are they busting his chops?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: He's okay. They sobered him up.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Did he say what they're asking him about?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Jimmy.  I don't know.  I got so much else on my mind.  I got the kids.  We got no money.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I gotta talk to him as soon as I can.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: He says he's too hot.  He doesn't even know I came here today.  It's like he's crazy. Jimmy.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I know. I know. But it'll be okay. Don't worry. I got some money for you. It's down the block.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: The third store down.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Jimmy just stood there on the sidewalk. It felt funny. I started walking down the block, but I noticed the stores were empty.

turns.speaker: KAREN'S MOTHER
turns.text: He didn't call?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: He's with his friends.

turns.speaker: KAREN'S MOTHER
turns.text: What kind of person doesn't call?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: He's a grown man. Be doesn't have to call every five minutes.

turns.speaker: KAREN'S MOTHER
turns.text: If he was so grown up he'd get you two an apartment.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Don't bring that up. You're the one who wanted us here.

turns.speaker: KAREN'S MOTHER
turns.text: Look. He's got the whole house in an uproar.

turns.speaker: KAREN'S MOTHER
turns.text: He's got your father upset. Good thing he doesn't have to go to work in the morning. Is this what he deserves?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Ma!  Please! You're driving me crazy.

turns.speaker: KAREN'S MOTHER
turns.text: Driving you crazy?  Don't get me started.  You're here a month and sometimes I know he doesn't come home at all. What kind of people are these?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Ma!  Stop! What do you want me to do?

turns.speaker: KAREN'S MOTHER
turns.text: Do?  What can you do?  What did you expect?  He wasn't Jewish. Did you know bow they live?  Your father would never stay out this late without calling.  In thirty years he never stayed out all night.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Stayed out? Daddy never went out at all.

turns.speaker: MCDONALD
turns.text: We'll pack up everything and send it to you.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I got dry cleaning.

turns.speaker: MCDONALD
turns.text: We'll pick it up.

turns.speaker: MCDONALD
turns.text: Don't worry about the schools. We'll take care of the schools.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I don't want them left back.

turns.speaker: MCDONALD
turns.text: They won't be left back. They'll stay in their grade.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: That's important.

turns.speaker: VARIO
turns.text: If you knew those fucking kids. They're nuts. Especially that Tommy. What am I going to do with them?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: But I'm worried. I'm hearing all kinds of things. Paulie.  You know me all my life.  I've always done the right thing.

turns.speaker: VARIO
turns.text: You think that matters?  You think they give a shit about anything? The little bastards.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: But it isn't right, Paulie. That Tommy, he's making trouble for me all over town.  I can't go here.  I can't go there.

turns.speaker: VARIO
turns.text: You?  You think you're the only one?  I've talked to them a million times, but they don't listen.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: But, Paulie, please.

turns.speaker: VARIO
turns.text: Someday they'll get what's coming to them. That's the only way they'll stop.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Paulie, I swear, I'm afraid. The guy's nuts. What do I have to do? Whatever I gotta do, I'll do.

turns.speaker: VARIO
turns.text: What can I do? If I could do something, don't you think I would?

turns.speaker: VARIO
turns.text: You want a partner?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Please?

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: You guys know my cousin Mikey Sullivan?

turns.speaker: ALL
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Well you know how he loves animals right? Anyway, last week he's drivin' home...

turns.speaker: ALL
turns.text: What? Come on!

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: I'm sorry, 'cause you know Mikey, the fuckin guy loves animals, and this is the last person you'd want this to happen to.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Two weeks? That's nothin'. My Uncle Marty? Will knows him. That guy fuckin' drinks like you've never seen! One night he was drivin' back to his house on I-93-- Statie pulls him over.

turns.speaker: ALL
turns.text: Oh shit.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Guy's tryin' to walk the line--but he can't even fuckin' stand up, and so my uncle's gonna spend a night in jail. Just then there's this fuckin' BOOM like fifty yards down the road. Some guy's car hit a tree.

turns.speaker: ALL
turns.text: No way! You're kiddin'!

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: No, he was so hammered that he drove the police cruiser home. Fuckin' lights and everything!

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Who's she talking to?

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: That fuckin' guinea, Will knows him.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: --Yah, restructurin' the amount of retards they had workin' for them.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Fuck you, you fat fuck.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Least I work for a livin'.  Why'd you get fired?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Submit, bitch! Submit! Submit!

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Suck my cock!

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Oh, Morgan!

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Keep fuckin' with me. Watch what happens.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: All right, then.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Watch what happens.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I've been shit faced for like two weeks.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Oh great, tell her that! Now she really thinks we're problem drinkers!

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Chuckie, what the fuck happened?

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Okay. He's driving along and this fuckin' cat jumps in front of his car, and so he hits this cat--

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Yeah, so he's like "Check the front of my truck, I can prove I hit it 'cause there's probably some blood or something"--

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: --or a tail--

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Stop brushin' me back!

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Stop crowdin the plate!

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Casey's bouncin' at a bar up Harvard. We should go there sometime.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: What are we gonna do up there?

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: I don't know, we'll fuck up some smart kids.  You'd prob'ly fit right in.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Fuck you.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: She's sharp as a marble.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: We're not goin'.  I don't even like "Kelly's."

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: She didn't do it again did she?

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Jesus Christ. Not even close.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Jesus, that's really bad, did anyone even order a Flyin' Fish?

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: No, and we got four of 'em.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: What do we got?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I don't know yet.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Hey, thanks for comin' out.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Yeah, you're all invited over to Morgan's house for a complementary fish sandwhich.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: When's the arraignment?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Next week.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: What'd you get? You get leniency?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Probation, counselin', few days a week.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: You're fuckin' good.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Who'd you call?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: No one. I didn't have the number.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: I didn't get on Cathy last night.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I don't know what the fuck you're doin'. You're givin' us a ride.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: What do I look like, Al Cowlins?  You want to take my car, drop her off?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I was countin' on it.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Thanks, Chuck.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Don't get too slap-happy, you're takin' me home first. WILL I don't know, Chuck. It's kinda outta the way.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: How's the woman?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Gone.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: She went to Medical school in California.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Sorry, brother.  I don't know what to tell ya. You know all the girls I been with. You been with 'em too, except for Cheryl McGovern which was a big mistake on your part brother...

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Oh I'm sure, that's why only one of us has herpes.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Some shows are worth the price of admission, partner.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Suck my crank. Fuckin' sheet metal pussy.  So, when are you done with those meetin's?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Week after I'm twenty-one.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Are they hookin' you up with a job?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Yeah, sit in a room and do long division for the next fifty years.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Yah, but it's better than this shit. At least you'd make some nice bank.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Yeah, be a fuckin' lab rat.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: It's a way outta here.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: What do I want a way outta here for? I want to live here the rest of my life. I want to be your next door neighbor. I want to take out kids to little league together up Foley Field.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Look, you're my best friend, so don't take this the wrong way, but in 20 years, if you're livin' next door to me, comin' over watchin' the fuckin' Patriots' games and still workin' construction, I'll fuckin' kill you. And that's not a threat, that's a fact. I'll fuckin' kill you.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Chuckie, what are you talkin'...

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Listen, you got somethin' that none of us have.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Why is it always this? I owe it to myself? What if I don't want to?

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Fuck you. You owe it to me. Tomorrow I'm gonna wake up and I'll be fifty and I'll still be doin' this. And that's all right 'cause I'm gonna make a run at it. But you, you're sittin' on a winning lottery ticket and you're too much of a pussy to cash it in. And that's bullshit 'cause I'd do anything to have what you got! And so would any of these guys. It'd be a fuckin' insult to us if you're still here in twenty years.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You don't know that.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Let me tell you what I do know. Every day I come by to pick you up, and we go out drinkin' or whatever and we have a few laughs. But you know what the best part of my day is? The ten seconds before I knock on the door 'cause I let myself think I might get there, and you'd be gone. I'd knock on the door and you wouldn't be there. You just left.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You and Morgan throw?

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: No, I had to talk him down.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Why didn't you yoke him?

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Little Morgan's got a lot a scrap, dude. I'd rather fight a big kid, they never fight, everyone's scared of 'em. You know how many people try to whip Morgan's ass every week? Fuckin' kid won't back down.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You're kiddin' me.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Yeah, I figured now that you got your big job over in Cambridge, you needed some way to get over there and I knew I wasn't gonna drive you every day...

turns.speaker: SKYLAR
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: So, you ladies ah, go to school here?

turns.speaker: SKYLAR
turns.text: What class?

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Ah, history I think.

turns.speaker: SKYLAR
turns.text: Oh...

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Yah, it's not a bad school...

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: I'm glad you came by, changed my opinion of Harvard people.

turns.speaker: SKYLAR
turns.text: See ya' Chuckie. I had fun.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Yeah, not tonight. Not any other night. He knows, once you see that shit-hole he's gettin' dropped like a bad habit.

turns.speaker: SKYLAR
turns.text: I wanted to meet your brothers...

turns.speaker: SKYLAR
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: How you doin'?

turns.speaker: SKYLAR
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: How'd you know where to find me?

turns.speaker: SKYLAR
turns.text: You were the only Sullivan in the phone book.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Oh, right.

turns.speaker: SKYLAR
turns.text: This is your house, right?

turns.speaker: SKYLAR
turns.text: I guess so.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: What? No. This is my mother's house. I don't live with my mother. I just stop by, help out. I'm good like that.

turns.speaker: SKYLAR
turns.text: Is this a bad time?

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: She'll live.  If she starts yelling again I might have to run in real quick and beat her with the stick again but...

turns.speaker: SKYLAR
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Let's take a walk. EXT. CHUCKIE'S STREET -- DAY

turns.speaker: SKYLAR
turns.text: See, now this doesn't feel right.  When I made the decision to come over here it felt right. I had all these rationalizations... I just don't understand why Will never tells me anything, he won't let me get close to him, he tells me these weird lies--

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: You caught that, huh?

turns.speaker: SKYLAR
turns.text: I just wanted to find out what was going on...But now that I'm here it seems strange, doesn't it?

turns.speaker: CHUCKIE
turns.text: Well, I don't have no trousers on...
